column2: With the Grand Palace now complete, the family invests its vast fortunes in acquiring luxurious villas and merchant estates scattered across the republic's most prosperous counties. These properties allow the patriarch to personally manage additional territories, expanding his direct control beyond traditional limits.

The family's ambition grows unchecked. Entire districts of opulent manors, warehouses, and private docks are purchased, weaving a web of personal holdings that bolsters the Doge's authority and lets him oversee even more lands with iron efficiency.

A sprawling empire of gilded residences, fortified compounds, and commercial enclaves now spans the realm, all under the family's unyielding grip. This monumental expansion cements their dominance, granting the patriarch dominion over territories once thought impossible for a single house to hold.
